In accordance with the needs of modern education, the departments of Visual Communication Design (VCD), Film and Television (FTV) and Photography & Video (POV) give high priority to international engagement. This involvement takes place in three core areas. The first one covers the departments' membership to various international networks; the second is the exchange programs and the third is participation in international festivals and events. The current international student and instructor exchanges take place within the scope of the Erasmus Program and other bilateral exchange agreements. Through the Erasmus agreements signed with 16 universities in Europe, VCD, FTV and POV Departments provide their students with the opportunity to spend part of their study abroad and present the visiting students with the unique chance of partaking in the welcoming and vibrant academic environment at BİLGİ.

The Erasmus Program was established by the European Union to enhance quality in and reinforce the European dimension of higher education, by encouraging transnational cooperation between universities. The Erasmus Program in particular, is designed to foster student and teaching staff mobility in Europe.
İstanbul Bilgi University began to participate in the Erasmus Program during the 2004-2005 academic year. BİLGİ provides its students with an opportunity to live and study in Europe in order to broaden their educational and cultural horizons under the framework of the Erasmus Program. For this purpose, many BİLGİ departments have established Erasmus partnerships with their counterparts, at numerous distinguished European universities. Students who participate in the Erasmus Program may spend between three months and a full academic year abroad at BİLGİ’s partner universities. Erasmus students may benefit from EU mobility grants.
Undergraduate students must have completed one full year of their academic Program at BİLGİ before applying for an exchange. Students must return to their home universities at the end of the exchange period and complete their Program of study at their home university. Credits obtained from the partner university are applied towards graduation at BİLGİ, subject to the approval of relevant BİLGİ units.
The Erasmus Program at BİLGİ is managed by the International Office at the institutional level. The International Office is responsible for the announcements, applications, selection of students, mobility grants etc. Also every BİLGİ department has an Erasmus coordinator, responsible for academic advising and the agreements of the department.

Eligibility Criteria:
- Successful completion of the first year of the degree Program.
- Minimum GPA of 2.0 for undergraduate, 2.5 for graduate students.

Students should apply to the International Office with the documents listed below:
- Application Form. (http://studyabroad.bilgi.edu.tr/docs/Study_Abroad_Form.doc)
- Letter of Intent in English, explaining why you want to participate in the exchange Program, why you would be a suitable candidate, where you want to go and why.
- CV in English.
- Transcript of Records. (student copy)
